title: JavaScript Test Lab
description: TwilioQuest scientists are researching "ducktypium", a recently discovered energy source which is as powerful as it is unstable. Visit the test lab to learn more about the JavaScript programming language, and about the research team's experiment.

flavorTextOverrides.bookshelf: Hmmm... A lot of classics in here. "You Don't Know JS", "JavaScript: The Good Parts", and a bunch more.
flavorTextOverrides.ducktypium: Whoa, this is pure Ducktypium. Powerful, but highly unstable. If the JavaScript in this lab is powered by this stuff, no wonder there’s the occasional insurance claim.
flavorTextOverrides.passwordDeskNote: Written on a sticky note on her desk: "Stasis Beam Password: PEW PEW PEW!"
flavorTextOverrides.officeTerminal: This screen is monitoring the temperature in the Ducktypium room. Its a balmy 21°C.
flavorTextOverrides.officeBookshelf: There are lots of different past experiment notebooks in here. Mutations, tranformations, prototypes, and more stuff.
flavorTextOverrides.opensMar2020: The adventure continues this way in early May 2020 - check back later this month, follow Cedric on Twitter, and sign up for our newsletter to be the first to know when this area opens up!
flavorTextOverrides.playerPlantedTree: Your very own tree! It represents an actual tree that will be planted in Australia to help recover from the recent wildfires there.
flavorTextOverrides.loopLockInfo: This strange room displays a number, just like the numbers outside the secure cargo holds on the ship. I wonder if they're connected? I should take a walk around this room to see what happens...
